name: tasks
title: Tasks API
description: Lets you manage your tasks and task lists.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Token that can be used to request the next page of this result.

fields.name: etag
fields.desc: ETag of the resource.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Collection of task lists.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of the resource. This is always "tasks#taskLists".

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Collection of tasks.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of the resource. This is always "tasks#tasks".

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Token used to access the next page of this result.

fields.name: etag
fields.desc: ETag of the resource.

fields.name: updated
fields.desc: Last modification time of the task (as a RFC 3339 timestamp).

fields.name: completed
fields.desc: Completion date of the task (as a RFC 3339 timestamp). This field is omitted if the task has not been completed.

fields.name: deleted
fields.desc: Flag indicating whether the task has been deleted. The default if False.

fields.name: due
fields.desc: Due date of the task (as a RFC 3339 timestamp). Optional.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: URL pointing to this task. Used to retrieve, update, or delete this task.

fields.name: parent
fields.desc: Parent task identifier. This field is omitted if it is a top-level task. This field is read-only. Use the "move" method to move the task under a different parent or to the top level.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: Status of the task. This is either "needsAction" or "completed".

fields.name: etag
fields.desc: ETag of the resource.

fields.name: hidden
fields.desc: Flag indicating whether the task is hidden. This is the case if the task had been marked completed when the task list was last cleared. The default is False. This field is read-only.

fields.name: links
fields.desc: Collection of links. This collection is read-only.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: The description. In HTML speak: Everything between and .

fields.name: link
fields.desc: The URL.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: Type of the link, e.g. "email".

fields.name: notes
fields.desc: Notes describing the task. Optional.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Task identifier.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of the resource. This is always "tasks#task".

fields.name: position
fields.desc: String indicating the position of the task among its sibling tasks under the same parent task or at the top level. If this string is greater than another task's corresponding position string according to lexicographical ordering, the task is positioned after the other task under the same parent task (or at the top level). This field is read-only. Use the "move" method to move the task to another position.

fields.name: title
fields.desc: Title of the task.

fields.name: etag
fields.desc: ETag of the resource.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Task list identifier.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of the resource. This is always "tasks#taskList".

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: URL pointing to this task list. Used to retrieve, update, or delete this task list.

fields.name: title
fields.desc: Title of the task list.

fields.name: updated
fields.desc: Last modification time of the task list (as a RFC 3339 timestamp).

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes the authenticated user's specified task list.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Returns the authenticated user's specified task list.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Creates a new task list and adds it to the authenticated user's task lists.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Returns all the authenticated user's task lists.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Maximum number of task lists returned on one page. Optional. The default is 100.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Token specifying the result page to return. Optional.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Updates the authenticated user's specified task list. This method supports patch semantics.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates the authenticated user's specified task list.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Creates a new task on the specified task list.

optinalQueryParams.name: previous
optinalQueryParams.desc: Previous sibling task identifier. If the task is created at the first position among its siblings, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

optinalQueryParams.name: parent
optinalQueryParams.desc: Parent task identifier. If the task is created at the top level, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Returns all tasks in the specified task list.

optinalQueryParams.name: updatedMin
optinalQueryParams.desc: Lower bound for a task's last modification time (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by last modification time.

optinalQueryParams.name: completedMax
optinalQueryParams.desc: Upper bound for a task's completion date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by completion date.

optinalQueryParams.name: dueMin
optinalQueryParams.desc: Lower bound for a task's due date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by due date.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Token specifying the result page to return. Optional.

optinalQueryParams.name: showDeleted
optinalQueryParams.desc: Flag indicating whether deleted tasks are returned in the result. Optional. The default is False.

optinalQueryParams.name: showHidden
optinalQueryParams.desc: Flag indicating whether hidden tasks are returned in the result. Optional. The default is False.

optinalQueryParams.name: completedMin
optinalQueryParams.desc: Lower bound for a task's completion date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by completion date.

optinalQueryParams.name: dueMax
optinalQueryParams.desc: Upper bound for a task's due date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by due date.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Maximum number of task lists returned on one page. Optional. The default is 100.

optinalQueryParams.name: showCompleted
optinalQueryParams.desc: Flag indicating whether completed tasks are returned in the result. Optional. The default is True.

methods.name: move
methods.desc: Moves the specified task to another position in the task list. This can include putting it as a child task under a new parent and/or move it to a different position among its sibling tasks.

optinalQueryParams.name: parent
optinalQueryParams.desc: New parent task identifier. If the task is moved to the top level, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

optinalQueryParams.name: previous
optinalQueryParams.desc: New previous sibling task identifier. If the task is moved to the first position among its siblings, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Updates the specified task. This method supports patch semantics.

methods.name: clear
methods.desc: Clears all completed tasks from the specified task list. The affected tasks will be marked as 'hidden' and no longer be returned by default when retrieving all tasks for a task list.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes the specified task from the task list.
